intro: Orthosiphon bolusii, commonly known as the African senna, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in dry, open habitats. Orthosiphon bolusii is valued for its medicinal properties and is used in traditional herbal remedies.
